title: Ruck Ready
description: Perfect for complete beginners or those returning from injury. Build the habit, learn proper form, and establish your rucking foundation. Start with light weight and focus on consistency over intensity.

title: Foundation Builder
description: Build a solid rucking foundation with progressive training. Perfect for those who completed Ruck Ready or have some rucking experience. Establish 3-4 rucks per week and build to 25 lbs.

title: Active Lifestyle
description: Maintain your fitness with a flexible, sustainable rucking routine. Perfect for busy professionals who want to stay active without following a strict program. 2-3 rucks per week, your choice of days.

title: Endurance Build
description: Build serious aerobic capacity with progressive mileage. This intermediate program takes you from 3-4 mile rucks to 10+ miles. Focus on time on feet and developing mental toughness. 3-4 rucks per week with progressive distance.

title: GORUCK Light Prep
description: Train for the GORUCK Light Challenge: 4-6 hours, 8-10 miles, 20+ lbs minimum. This program prepares you with progressive rucks, PT circuits, and team-based work capacity training. Perfect first GORUCK event prep.

title: GORUCK Tough Prep
description: Prepare for the GORUCK Tough Challenge: 10-12 hours, 15-20 miles, 30+ lbs minimum. Advanced program with 4-5 rucks per week, multiple weekly PT sessions, and some 2-a-day training. Serious commitment required.

title: Military Foundation
description: Build military-level fitness with rucking, PT standards, and functional strength. Based on Army ACFT requirements. Includes ruck progressions, pushups, situps, deadlifts, and run training. Perfect for those wanting military-style fitness.

title: Strength & Power
description: Increase load capacity and functional strength. This program combines 3 rucks per week with 2 dedicated strength sessions. Progressive weight from 30-45 lbs. Includes weighted carries, farmers walks, and sandbag work.

title: Ruck Marathon
description: Complete 26.2 miles with load. This advanced endurance program builds progressive mileage to peak at 20-mile training rucks. Requires 4-5 rucks per week with emphasis on long, slow distance. Includes proper tapering strategy.

title: Ranger Challenge
description: Elite military-style training program. Fast-paced rucks, team events, and obstacle preparation. 5-6 days per week training including multiple 2-a-days. Progressive to 45+ lbs at military pace standards. Only for experienced ruckers.
